thread.title: Hired by a Dying Client
thread.title_full: Hired by a Dying Client - WSJ

author: Cheryl Winokur Munk
title: Hired by a Dying Client
text:
After a string of accidents, a 63-year-old woman was diagnosed with progressive supranuclear palsy, a rare brain disorder. Her doctors said she had only about two years to live. The woman, who had retired early and hoped to travel, now needed to sell her home, arrange for full-time care and make preparations for her death.
She didnâ€™t have many friends nearby and her 94-year-old mother was her only close relative. A friend and former neighbor suggested the woman seek help from Linda Conti, a senior vice president and... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
